attributes.action: Make all dog walking and pet sitting (all animals) in other's property regulated
attributes.additional_details:
With the significant rise in dogs in the UK people are seeing dog walking and sitting as a quick way to earn big money, without being regulated.
There have been a number of issues both minor and major, including death of the animal, due to neglectful care. 
All day care, boarders and kennels require a license, but there is a loophole for those who work in others properties and they do not require a license. 
The UK is a big dog loving nation and we need to stand together to protect our animals.
attributes.background:
Anybody paid to look after other people's animals, need to be licensed and regulated. 
With Pet first aid and relevant insurance as a minimum. 
It should be compulsory for anybody advertising to display their details and share with customer at booking. 
A full monitored complaint procedure.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a very similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621036
